case_title: G.V.K. INDUSTRIES LIMITED and another vs INCOME-TAX OFFICER and another

key_issues.issue: Whether the 'success fee' payable by the petitioner-company to the NRC or any portion thereof is chargeable under the provisions of the Income Tax Act, 1961.
Whether the petitioner-company is entitled to a 'no objection certificate'.

facts.project_details: Constructed a power generating station with a capacity of 235 MW near Rajahmundry, Andhra Pradesh
facts.consultant: ABB--Projects and Trade Finance (International) Ltd., Zurich, Switzerland (NRC)
facts.application_section: Section 195 of the Income Tax Act, 1961

contentions: NRC rendered services from outside India and had no business connection in India.
Success fee does not accrue or arise in India under Section 9(1)(i) or 9(1)(vii).
Petitioner-company was not an agent of NRC.
NRC provided managerial and consultancy services.
Income deemed to accrue or arise in India under Section 9(1)(i) and 9(1)(vii)(b).
Petitioner-company acted on behalf of NRC for processing loans.

court_findings.business_connection: No business connection established between petitioner-company and NRC.
court_findings.technical_services: Success fee falls within the ambit of 'fees for technical services' under Section 9(1)(vii)(b).
court_findings.legislative_validity: Section 9(1)(vii)(b) upheld as valid by previous judgments.

judgment_summary.decision: The 'success fee' is chargeable under the provisions of the Income Tax Act, 1961.
judgment_summary.no_objection_certificate: Petitioner-company not entitled to 'no objection certificate'.
